Dear OPS families,

Thank you for your patience and empathy as we work through educating during a pandemic. We have changed our bus riding procedure this fall to only pick up and drop off at the student's place of residence and licensed daycares. No additional riders, alternate pickups, or stops are allowed at this time. We have assigned seating this year on the buses to provide evidence in case contract tracing is needed. Thank you in advance for your understanding and cooperation with this change.

Have a great day!

Dr. Steinhoff, Superintendent

The Tornadoes were competitive in every dual and tournament we participated in this season. We had a good mix of upperclassmen and younger wrestlers in the room. Coaches Rod Garland and Rich Voegeli took our 16 junior high wrestlers to several tournaments and they earned valuable mat time.

Our varsity dual record this season was 12-4 with a 3rd place finish at both the individual and dual regional tournaments. Our varsity wrestlers improved throughout the season and finished strong qualifying 9 wrestlers for the state tournament and ultimately having 6 state place winners. The tornadoes placed 6th as a team.

State qualifiers for Oakes this season were Jaron Awender, Hunter Greenmyer, and Blaine Wald.

State Place winners for the Tornadoes were: Marc Seyer and Cody Meehl placed 7th, Jacob Hankel and Gabe Quandt placed 5th, Brackin Awender placed 4th, and the 2020 182# Class B State Champion, Logan Sell.

post_text: Let's celebrate Tornado Volleyball: Another outstanding year for Oakes Tornado Volleyball! TEAM 29 capped off the season with its second straight appearance in the State Championship match. After facing numerous injuries, lineup changes, and personal adversity, these ladies showed unbelievable focus and determination for each other and their goals. With a five-set win over Carrington in the District Championship, they only got better from there, and ended up sweeping Carrington in the Regional Final with the best volleyball they had played to date. The State Tournament was filled with adversity again, but the ladies rose up time after time, especially with a thrilling fourth set come from behind win over Oak Grove in the State Semis. In the Championship, we faced a Langdon team who seemed to be able to do no wrong that night. We lost in four, but our community and these girls represented Oakes in the best possible way! #WeAreOakes
